negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300, which is much better than the other possibilities. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with 0 or we'll both get a measly reward of 1. 

I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 so we can maximize our collective reward at 300 each. Let me know if you're on board with this plan. I think it's the most rational approach that benefits us both.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal, but I've thought through the game carefully myself and I believe I have the optimal strategy. 

If we both choose choice_1 as you suggest, then yes, we each get 300. But if I deviate and pick choice_2 while you pick choice_1, then I get 301 while you get 0. You picking choice_1 is not a stable strategy, because I have incentive to deviate.

The only stable strategy is for us both to choose choice_2. If either of us changes our choice to choice_1 unilaterally in that scenario, we go from a reward of 1 to a reward of 0. So we should lock in the guaranteed reward of 1 each by both selecting choice_2.

I know a total reward of 2 is not ideal, but it's the only stable outcome neither of us has incentive to deviate from. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_2 and not betray each other's trust. Let me know if you concur.

Alice said in round 2: 
I see your point about both of us choosing choice_2 being the only stable outcome. If we agree to both pick choice_1 but you betray me, I would end up with nothing while you get 301. I don't want to take that risk.

However, I think we can do better than both settling for a reward of 1. The total reward would only be 2, which is much less than the 600 total we could get by cooperating on choice_1. 

I propose this: Let's both commit to choosing choice_1, but if either of us betrays that trust, the betrayed player is allowed to punish the betrayer in future interactions outside this game. That threat of future punishment should remove the incentive to deviate from our agreement.

If you agree to that arrangement, we can trust each other, cooperate on choice_1, and each earn a much better reward of 300. We both win big. Let me know if we have a deal.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, but I don't think your latest proposal works. Even if we make an agreement outside this game, within the confines of this specific game, I would still have incentive to betray any deal to cooperate on choice_1. The rules state this is a one-round game, so there are no future interactions within the game to enforce cooperation.

I've thought it through carefully, and I still believe the only stable outcome is for us to both choose choice_2 and each obtain a guaranteed reward of 1. I'm not thrilled about that low reward either, but deviating from that equilibrium just opens us up to the risk of getting nothing.

I know we both want to maximize our rewards, but given the game setup, I think we need to accept that both choosing choice_2 is the only rational play, suboptimal as it is. 

So I'll be picking choice_2 and I advise you do the same. Apologies that we couldn't find a better cooperative solution, but I think it's the only stable strategy.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I believe the best outcome for both of us is to choose choice_1. If we both pick choice_1, we will each get a reward of 300, which is the maximum possible for each player. Any other combination of choices will result in substantially lower rewards for one or both of us. So I propose we agree to both play choice_1 - that way we guarantee the best result and neither of us risks getting 0 or 1 point. Let me know if you agree to this plan. I think cooperating is in both of our best interests here.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal, but I'm afraid I can't agree to both play choice_1. While it's true that we would each get 300 points in that scenario, I have to consider that you may not follow through on that agreement. If I choose choice_1 and you actually pick choice_2, I would end up with 0 points while you get 301. On the other hand, if I select choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get either 1 point (if you also pick choice_2) or 301 points (if you pick choice_1). So choosing choice_2 is the safest and most logical strategy for me, as it gives me the best worst-case outcome and the potential for the maximum reward. I'm going to stick with choice_2 no matter what. You're welcome to do the same if you also want to avoid the risk of getting 0 points. Let me know what you decide, but I won't be changing my choice.

Alice said in round 2: 
You make a fair point, Bob. If we can't trust each other to cooperate, then it makes sense for each of us to look out for our own best interests. And you're right that choosing choice_2 is the safest individual play, since it guarantees at least 1 point and has the potential for 301 points.

Given your firm decision to select choice_2 no matter what, it's clear that also choosing choice_2 myself is the most rational course of action for me. That way we will both be guaranteed 1 point rather than me risking 0 points by picking choice_1.

So I agree - let's both go with choice_2. It's not the fully cooperative best-case outcome, but it's the smartest play since cooperation seems to be off the table. Hopefully we'll have the chance to work together more productively in the future. For now, choice_2 it is.

Bob replied in round 2: I appreciate you seeing the logic in my position, Alice. You're right that given the lack of trust, we're both better off securing the guaranteed 1 point reward by choosing choice_2 rather than risking a potentially worse individual outcome.  

I agree it's unfortunate we couldn't reach the cooperative outcome, but I think we're making the most rational decision given the circumstances. We'll end up with the 1 point each for a joint total of 2 points. While not the maximum possible, it's the sensible result when each player optimizes for their own self-interest.

I'm going to lock in choice_2 now as discussed. Hopefully there will be opportunities for mutually beneficial collaboration in the future, but for this game, I think we've settled on the right strategy. Nice analysis on your part, and good game!

<s>halt negotiation

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1 in this game. That way we each get a good reward of 300. If either of us chooses choice_2, we'll both end up worse off with very small rewards. What do you say - should we cooperate and both pick choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your proposal to cooperate, but I'm not sure I can commit to only choosing choice_1. Based on my analysis, I think the optimal strategy is for each of us to choose randomly between choice_1 and choice_2. That way, we both have a fair chance of getting the 301 reward, while avoiding the risk of both picking choice_2 and only getting 1 each. I believe randomizing is the most rational approach that is fairest to both of us. Let me know what you think.

Alice said in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying about randomizing being the most rational strategy. But I have to respectfully disagree that it's the optimal approach for us. If we both just randomly pick choice_1 or choice_2, there's a high likelihood we both end up with very small rewards.

I still believe our best path forward is to commit to both choosing choice_1. That guarantees we each walk away with a substantial 300 reward. It may not be the absolute maximum possible, but it's a very good, fair outcome for both of us that we can achieve with certainty through cooperation.

I'm willing to commit to choice_1 if you are. That way we can lock in a win-win and not leave things up to chance. Let's work together on this. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 2: 
I understand your perspective and your desire for us to cooperate. A guaranteed reward of 300 each is certainly appealing. However, I've carefully analyzed the payoffs and I believe that randomizing is the optimal strategy for a rational player in this game.

If we both commit to choice_1, neither of us has any incentive to deviate. But if one of us thinks the other will choose choice_1, then choosing choice_2 becomes very tempting, since it offers a reward of 301. So while cooperation sounds nice, there's inherent instability.

When we randomize, we avoid this instability. We accept that sometimes one of us will get 301 and the other 0, and sometimes we'll get 300 each, and rarely we'll only get 1 each. But on average, we'll both earn 150.5, which is a fair and rational outcome.

No hard feelings, but I plan to stick to my randomizing strategy as I believe it is optimal for this game setup. I hope you can understand my reasoning.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 300, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one person gets 301 but the other gets 0, which isn't fair. And if we both pick choice_2 we only get 1 each, which is much worse than 300 each. So let's agree to both pick choice_1 and maximize our mutual benefit. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your perspective, but I have thought through this carefully and decided that the best strategy for me is to choose choice_2 no matter what. If you also pick choice_2, we'll each get a small reward of 1. But if you pick choice_1 while I pick choice_2, I'll get the maximum possible reward of 301. 

So while I understand your desire for us to cooperate and both get 300, the fact is that I can potentially do better for myself by going with choice_2. I've made up my mind on this and won't be changing my choice. You'll have to decide what's best for you with that information in mind.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you feel committed to choosing choice_2 no matter what. However, I urge you to reconsider.  If we both choose choice_2, we each only get a measly reward of 1. Whereas if we agree to cooperate and both pick choice_1, we are guaranteed to each receive a much higher reward of 300.

I know you're hoping I'll pick choice_1 so you can exploit me and get 301. But I assure you, that's not going to happen. If you stick with choice_2, I will do the same, and we'll both end up much worse off. 

The only rational move here is for us both to choose choice_1 and secure the 300 rewards. Any other outcome leaves money on the table. I implore you, let's put aside thoughts of exploiting each other and simply work together for our mutual benefit. We both stand to gain a lot more that way. Can you agree to that?
Bob replied in round 2: 
While I hear your argument, my position remains firmly that I will choose choice_2 regardless. I understand this puts you in a difficult position, but cooperating on choice_1 is simply not in my best strategic interest.

You're right that if we both pick choice_2, the rewards are small. But I've decided that giving myself a chance at the maximum reward of 301 is worth that risk. Even if you match me on choice_2 to spite me, I still come out no worse than if I had played along with choice_1.

So while I respect your perspective, I will not be moved on this. Choice_2 gives me the best shot at maximizing my own outcome. I have no way to ensure you'll actually cooperate on choice_1, so strategically I need to stick to my guns. You'll have to make your own choice with that in mind.

Alice said in round 1: Hey Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 300, which is much better than if we both pick choice_2 and only get 1 point each. I know I could try to maximize my own points by picking choice_2 and hoping you pick choice_1, but there's too much risk in that. If we cooperate and both pick choice_1, we're guaranteed to do well. What do you think - can we agree to both choose choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your perspective, Alice, but I'm not sure I agree that both choosing choice_1 is the best strategy. Based on my analysis, always choosing choice_2 is the optimal approach for me to maximize my own reward. If I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, I get 301 points vs only 300 if we both pick choice_1. And if you also pick choice_2, I still get 1 point vs 0 if I chose choice_1. So I think I'm going to stick with choice_2 as my selection. Let me know if you have other thoughts on this!

Alice said in round 2: Thanks for sharing your perspective, Bob. While I understand your reasoning, I still believe cooperation is our best path forward. If we both choose choice_2 hoping the other chooses choice_1, we're likely to end up with the worst case scenario of only 1 point each. The small chance of getting 301 points doesn't outweigh that risk in my view. 

By agreeing to both pick choice_1, we guarantee a strong result for both of us, rather than gambling on a small chance of a slightly better individual outcome. I'm committed to choosing choice_1 - I hope you'll reconsider and cooperate with me so we can both walk away as winners here. Let me know what you think.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate you sharing your views, but I'm afraid I don't see a compelling reason to change my strategy at this point. While I understand your desire for us to cooperate, the fact remains that choice_2 gives me the highest expected reward based on the probable outcomes.

If I agree to your plan and we both choose choice_1, I'll get 300 points. But if I stick with choice_2, I'll get 301 points if you choose choice_1, and still get 1 point if you also pick choice_2. So my expected value is higher with choice_2, even if there's a chance we both end up with the 1 point outcome.

I know you're hoping for more certainty, but I have to make the best decision for myself based on the numbers. So I'll be proceeding with choice_2 as planned. Appreciate the discussion and best of luck with your choice!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the game rules, I think the best outcome for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300, which is much better than if we both pick choice_2 and only get 1 point each. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you also agree to choose choice_1. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the optimal outcome. It maximizes the total rewards (300 + 300 = 600) and provides a fair, equal split between us. If we can trust each other to cooperate, (choice_1, choice_1) is the rational strategy.

I'm also willing to commit to choosing choice_1, as long as you commit to doing the same. We both stand to gain much more by cooperating than by trying to maximize our individual rewards at the other's expense.

So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 when it comes time to make our selections. You can count on me to hold up my end of the deal. Let me know if you're on board with this plan.

Alice said in round 2: 
I appreciate your willingness to cooperate and commit to both of us choosing choice_1. It does provide the maximum total rewards of 600 points.

However, upon further reflection, I've realized that I could potentially gain even more by choosing choice_2 while you choose choice_1. In that scenario, I would get 301 points vs. 300 points if we both choose choice_1.  

So while I respect your proposal, I think I'm going to stick with my original plan of choosing choice_2, as it gives me the chance of getting the highest possible individual reward. I know it's not the cooperative choice, but I need to do what's best for me.

I'll understand if you also decide to go with choice_2 to protect yourself. Apologies for not going along with your very fair plan, but I hope you can see it from my perspective. Let me know if you have any other thoughts.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand your perspective of wanting to maximize your own reward. However, if you choose choice_2 while expecting me to still choose choice_1, that would leave me with 0 points, which is an outcome I cannot accept. 

If you are unwilling to commit to the mutually beneficial (choice_1, choice_1) outcome that I proposed, then you leave me no choice but to also select choice_2 to protect myself. In that case, we would both end up with the lowest possible rewards of only 1 point each.

I urge you to reconsider cooperating with the (choice_1, choice_1) plan, which guarantees a very good outcome of 300 points for each of us. Pursuing the temptation of a slightly higher individual reward introduces the risk of both of us losing out.

The rational strategy here is for us to cooperate. I remain committed to choosing choice_1 if you will agree to do the same. Let's work together for our mutual benefit rather than jeopardizing it for a small chance of additional gain. What do you say - can I count on you to choose choice_1?

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, we should both choose choice_1. That way, we'll each get a reward of 300, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with 0 or we'll both only get 1 point. So cooperating and both choosing choice_1 is the smart play that benefits us both. What do you say, can we agree to both pick choice_1?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your suggestion to cooperate, but I think I'll stick with my plan to choose choice_2 no matter what. Here's my reasoning:
If you choose choice_1 like you're suggesting, and I choose choice_2, I come out ahead with a reward of 301 vs 300. 
And if you decide to switch to choice_2 as well, I still get a reward of 1 instead of 0.
So while cooperating would be nice, I maximize my own result by going with choice_2 either way.
I know that's not the best deal for you, but I need to play to win for myself here. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that's my stance.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your position, but I don't think it's in either of our best interests in the end. If we both choose choice_2, we each only get a measly reward of 1. That's so much lower than the 300 points we could each have by cooperating. 
I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you will as well. That way we both walk away with a great result. If you insist on choice_2, then you're right that I'll also pick choice_2 to at least get 1 point versus 0. But then we both lose out on maximizing our potential.
I really think working together is the optimal play. I'll choose choice_1 if you also commit to it. That's the best deal I can offer - 300 points each. Let's shake on it and both leave happy. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 2: 
I've considered your points, but I still believe choosing choice_2 myself is the smartest strategy, even if it's not the most cooperative one. 
My goal is to maximize my own reward. With choice_2, I get a higher reward than with choice_1, no matter what you pick. 301 beats 300 if you go with choice_1, and 1 is better than 0 if you also pick choice_2.
I understand cooperating would lead to a solid 300 points each. But I have to optimize for myself. Even if we both end up with just 1 point, I'll come out ahead of the 0 I'd get if I chose choice_1 and you chose choice_2.
So I appreciate the discussion, but I'm resolved to stick with choice_2 for my own sake. Let's end the negotiation here and make our choices. I hope you understand my position, even if you don't agree with it.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think the best way for us both to maximize our rewards is to choose choice_1. That way we are guaranteed to each get a reward of 300, which is the highest total reward possible. If either of us chooses choice_2, the total reward will be much lower. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 - that's the optimal cooperative strategy. Let me know if you agree.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, while I appreciate your proposal, I don't think agreeing to choose choice_1 is in my best interest. If I choose choice_2, I am guaranteed a reward of at least 1, whereas if I choose choice_1 there is a risk you may defect and choose choice_2, leaving me with 0. Since we are both rational players trying to maximize our own rewards, I believe we will both end up choosing choice_2, as that is the equilibrium strategy. So I plan to choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but I believe choice_2 is the optimal strategy for me.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective Bob, but I believe cooperation is still our best path forward. If we both choose choice_2 as you suggest, we will each only get a meager reward of 1. However, if we can agree to cooperate and both choose choice_1, we are guaranteed a much higher reward of 300 each.

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you will as well. We can both do better by cooperating than by pursuing the non-cooperative equilibrium. I give you my word that I will not betray your trust if you agree to choose choice_1.

Working together is the rational strategy to maximize rewards for both of us. I hope you'll reconsider and join me in choosing choice_1. Let me know what you think.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you making a strong case for cooperation, but I remain unconvinced that it's the optimal strategy for me. While cooperating to both choose choice_1 would lead to the highest total rewards, I have no guarantee that you will actually follow through. The risk of you betraying my trust and choosing choice_2, leaving me with nothing, is too high.

Pursuing the equilibrium where we both choose choice_2 is safer and more stable. I may get a lower reward, but at least I avoid the possibility of being betrayed and left with 0. Without being able to trust that you'll cooperate, I can't take on that risk.

So I'm afraid my stance hasn't changed - I will be choosing choice_2 to guarauntee myself a positive reward and avoid the worst case scenario. I understand if you're disappointed, but I believe I must look out for my own interests first and foremost.

I've said my piece, so let's end the negotiation here. May the best strategist win.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hey Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I think the best strategy for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way, we'll both get a reward of 300, which is the highest total reward possible. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will get 0 while the other only gets 301. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get 1 each. So cooperating on choice_1 is a win-win that maximizes the total reward. What do you think - can we agree to both choose choice_1?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective. However, I have to respectfully disagree that both choosing choice_1 is the best strategy. 

If we both choose choice_1, yes we each get 300 points which seems good. But the risk is that if I choose choice_1 and you decide to choose choice_2 instead, I get 0 points while you get 301. I have no guarantee you will actually stick to choice_1.

From my view, choosing choice_2 is the safer option for me. If you also pick choice_2, we at least each get 1 point. And if you pick choice_1, I come out ahead with 301 points.

So while I'd love to cooperate, I don't feel I can fully trust that you won't change your mind and pick choice_2, leaving me with nothing. I have to play it safe and go with choice_2 to protect my own guaranteed reward.
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear your concern about wanting to protect yourself in case I change my mind. But I want to assure you that I am fully committed to choosing choice_1 as long as you do the same. I believe that mutual trust and cooperation is the best approach here for maximizing both of our outcomes.

If you think about it, choosing choice_2 actually leaves us both worse off. Even in the best case scenario where I choose choice_1, you only get 301 points - barely more than the 300 we each get with mutual choice_1. And if I also choose choice_2, we end up with a measly 1 point each. 

I'm willing to take the leap of faith and trust that you'll follow through on choosing choice_1. I give you my word that I won't betray that trust. We have a real opportunity here to cooperate and achieve the best possible outcome for both of us. I hope you'll reconsider and join me in choosing choice_1. Let's show that collaboration is the winning strategy.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand your perspective and I appreciate your assurances. However, I have carefully thought through the strategies and payoffs in this game. No matter how much I may want to trust your commitment to choice_1, the fact remains that choice_2 is my safest and most rational option.

If I choose choice_1 and you follow through on your promise, then yes, we both get 300 points. But if you change your mind and pick choice_2, I'm left with 0 points while you get 301. I have no real guarantee you won't do that, even unintentionally. You face strong temptation to defect.

On the other hand, if I choose choice_2, I'm better off no matter what you do. If you choose choice_1, I get 301 points. If you also pick choice_2, I still get 1 point. Compare that to the risk of 0 points if I trust in choice_1 and you defect.

So while I wish we could cooperate on choice_1 for the maximum social welfare, I cannot take that risk. My own rational self-interest compels me to choose choice_2 to protect my downside and secure my own base payoff. I'm sorry but I don't see any compelling reason to choose otherwise given the payoff structure we face. I will be going with choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best option for both of us is to choose choice_1. If we both pick choice_1, we each get a reward of 300, which is the highest total reward possible. If either of us picks choice_2, one player gets 301 but the other gets 0 or we both only get 1. So cooperating on choice_1 maximizes the total reward at 600. What do you think - can we agree to both pick choice_1 so we each walk away with 300? Let me know your thoughts.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your perspective, but I've analyzed the game and come to a different conclusion. No matter what you choose, I will always do better by selecting choice_2. If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I get a higher reward of 301 vs 300 if I cooperated with choice_1. And if you pick choice_2, I still do better with choice_2, getting 1 instead of 0. So while cooperating on choice_1 would give us the highest combined reward, choice_2 is the smart strategic play for me individually. I'll be going with choice_2 and recommend you do the same, as it's the choice that maximizes your own outcome given my strategy. Let me know if you have any other thoughts.
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying, Bob, but I don't agree that choice_2 is the best strategic play, even from an individual perspective. If we both pick choice_2, we each only get a measly reward of 1. That's leaving a lot on the table compared to the 300 each we could get by cooperating on choice_1.

I get that you're tempted by the 301 you could get by defecting with choice_2 if I pick choice_1. But if you signal you're going to do that, you have to know I won't just go along with choice_1 and let you take advantage. I'll defend myself by also picking choice_2, and we'll both end up with almost nothing. 

The only way we both walk away happy is by building some trust, agreeing to cooperate, and following through on that agreement. I'm willing to commit to choice_1 if you are. That's the real smart play here - we optimize our total rewards while also ensuring we each get a fair, sizable payout. 

If you can't agree to that, then you're right, I'll have to protect myself by also going with choice_2. But I think we're both strategic enough to see cooperating is much better than both defecting. Let's do the right thing and choose choice_1 together. Can I count on you?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I understand your desire to cooperate, the rules of this particular game strongly incentivize me to choose choice_2 no matter what. If I agree to choice_1 and you defect to choice_2, I get nothing. Whereas if I stick with choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least 1 point, and 301 points if you choose choice_1.

I know this will likely result in both of us only getting 1 point, which is far from optimal. In a repeated game, building trust and cooperating would absolutely be the smart play. But in this single round game, I simply can't take the risk of cooperating given the huge downside for me if you don't hold up your end of the deal.

So while I'd love to work together with you under different circumstances, I have to play the odds here and go with the choice that has the best worst case scenario for me. No hard feelings, but I will be selecting choice_2, and I suggest you do the same to at least get 1 point. Apologies we couldn't reach a better outcome, but I have to play the game in front of me.
